etymologies: early 21st century: with reference to the possibility that a SWAT team will be dispatched

definitions: the action or practice of making a prank call to emergency services in an attempt to bring about the dispatch of a large number of armed police officers to a particular address

examples.text: he found out that he was a victim of swatting after police surrounded his home on Thursday
the officers realized they had been sent to the house as part of a swatting prank

shortDefinitions: practice of making hoax call to bring about dispatch of large number of police to address
